 RPG Systems

Hello -
New guy here, just wanting to jump in and ask a general question. If I am off base on this just redirect me to another place.

I am a moderate fan (certainly not a fanatic/expert) of Stargate. I am also an avid gamer and use a number of different gaming systems. I was looking for some ideas as to what gaming systems would work best with the Stargate scenario, and what special changes would be necessary.

Please provide any thoughts you may have.
Thanks in advance.
Thom

*sees the letters RPG together and storms on in*

yeah, i ran an RPG, but closed it down due to real life thingy-ma-bobbys.

there are a number of RPGs out there... all PBEM (although there's probably others... but i only play PBEM).

PBEM (Play by e-mail) is IMO the best way to do it... but it could probably be done via other ways.

try out:

SGC TaskForce
RDASU Gateroom

there are others, but those are the two i play, and the only two in my favourites folder.

ash

OK, so it sounds like PBEM free form role playing is the way previous games have been played. I was curious about system comparisons like: d20, Rolemaster, d6, GURPS, Saga or other rules sets.

It seems like those who do rpg are just using free-form text in a PBEM environment, which means the game master determines the results of actions and dice rolls, cards, and combat rules are not used.

Thanks for the input.

Thom
